list.title: Question 1
list.content: Jeremy invests $\$8000$ into a savings account that pays an annual interest rate of $5.5$ %, compounded annually. - Write down a formula which calculates that total value of the investment after $n$ years. [2] - Calculate the amount of money in the savings account after: - $1$ year; - $3$ years. [2] - Jeremy wants to use the money to put down a $\$10\hspace{0.15em}000$ deposit on an apartment. Determine if Jeremy will be able to do this within a $5$-year timeframe.[2]
list.markScheme:
- We have
  ![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/29dc8a60-0190-46e1-8d7c-a827be9924b6/images/828dc7db-36fb-4e0e-b60e-5970709ce9e1/eaedd006beb5ba238d9ad76a3a6f6101e049be71.svg)


  Hence, using the compound interest formula, we have

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \mathrm{FV} &= \mathrm{PV}\bigg(1 + \dfrac{r}{100k}\bigg)^{kn} \\[5pt]
  &= 8000\bigg(1 + \dfrac{5.5}{100\times1}\bigg)^{1\times n} \\[12pt]
  &\answer{= 8000\hspace{0.05em}(1+0.055)^n} \qref{(1)}\end{aligned}
  $$

- 
  - Substituting $n = 1$ in the formula $(1)$, we get

    $$
    \begin{aligned}
    \mathrm{FV} &= 8000\hspace{0.05em}(1+0.055) \hspace{0.5em} \\[8pt]
    &\answer{= \$8440}\end{aligned}
    $$

  - Substituting $n = 3$ in the formula $(1)$, we get

    $$
    \begin{aligned}
    \mathrm{FV} &= 8000\hspace{0.05em}(1+0.055)^3 \\[8pt]
    &\answer{\approx \$9390}\end{aligned}
    $$


- Substituting $n = 5$ in the formula $(1)$, we obtain

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{2.2em} \mathrm{FV} &= 8000\hspace{0.05em}(1+0.055)^5 \\[8pt]
  &\approx \$10\hspace{0.15em}456\end{aligned}
  $$

  $\answer{\text{Yes, Jeremy will be able to do this within a \(5\)-year timeframe.}}$

The value of the car depreciates by $10\%$ each year. - Find the total amount the car will depreciate after 5 years, giving your answer correct to the nearest dollar. [3] The price of a different used car depreciates by $5\%$ each year. - Find the value reduction of this car after $4$ years as a percentage, when compared to the original purchase price. [3]

  ![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/1ef72e0b-6daf-49bf-86a3-f321048cbc21/images/8ad5fa87-b19d-4552-90d8-eab141f1d092/6462608efbf9ba0d371a0ca7fdfe6437d1874af0.svg)

  &= 18\hspace{0.25em}000\bigg(1 - \dfrac{10}{100}\bigg)^{5}  \\[12pt]
  &\approx \$10\hspace{0.15em}629\end{aligned}
  $$

  Hence, after $5$
years the car has depreciated by

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{0.1em} \mathrm{PV} - \text{FV} &= 18\hspace{0.15em}000 - 10\hspace{0.15em}629 \\[6pt]
  &\answer{=\$\, 7\hspace{0.15em}371 }\end{aligned}

  Therefore,

  $$

  Hence, the reduction in
price after $4$ years as a percentage is

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{0.1em} 0.185\times 100\% \,\,\hspace{0.525em} \answer{=18.5\% }
  \end{aligned}
  $$
